name: Gary H. POWELL v. UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BOARD OF REVIEW, Joe Krentzman & Sons, Inc., Intervenor. Petition of Unemployment Compensation Board of Review
name_abbreviation: Powell v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review

parties: Gary H. POWELL v. UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BOARD OF REVIEW, Joe Krentzman & Sons, Inc., Intervenor. Petition of Unemployment Compensation Board of Review.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 13th day of April, 2016, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The issue as stated by petitioner is:
Should a Commonwealth agency be required to allow a suspended attorney to represent a party in its hearings and proceedings?
The Office of Disciplinary Counsel’s Application for Leave to File as Amicus Curiae in Support of Petition for Allowance of Appeal is DENIED. Andrew J. Ostrowski’s Application to Intervene is DENIED.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
134 A.3d 448
Gary H. POWELL v. UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BOARD OF REVIEW, Joe Krentzman & Sons, Inc., Intervenor. Petition of Unemployment Compensation Board of Review.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 13, 2016.
